# Create Docker container for Python Environment

  1. Install Docker Desktop (opens new window)
  • Do not forget to start Docker Desktop before get started coding and exit/quit Docker Desktop after you have done the project.
  1. Create Project folder
  2. Create files

  • project structure

    +-- your-project-folder
|    +-- .dockerignore
|    +-- Dockerfile
|    +-- docker-compose.yml

    Dockerfile

    FROM python:3.10.4-buster
WORKDIR /root/src

RUN pip install "numpy==1.22.3"
RUN pip install "pandas==1.4.2"
RUN pip install "matplotlib==3.5.1"
RUN pip install "ipykernel==6.13.0"

CMD tail -f /dev/null

    version: "3.8"

    context: .
    volumes:
        - ./src:/root/src
        - ./.vscode-server:/root/.vscode-server

  1. Use VSCode Remote - Containers (opens new window) and select /root/src for your code and other files.

  2. After finished the project, please remove the container.

docker-compose down
